APPLICATION.NAME: ora_te
APPLICATION.OVERVIEW: This documentation is generated from source code. For subprogram descriptions navigate to 'Object and Package Bodies' section.

PACKAGE_BODY.NAME: PK_TE
PACKAGE_BODY.COMMENT:
The package that provides functions to substitute values instead of placeholders.
Only functions and types that are to be called by end user are exposed. Some supporting functions are moved to PK_TE_IMPL.

RETURN.TYPE: table OF varchar2(32767 CHAR) INDEX BY varchar2(100 CHAR)

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_P_CACHE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a table of nested tables containg ty_p values

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_M_CACHE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a table of nested tables containg ty_m values

TAG.COMMENT: a_p_cache a table of nested tables containg ty_p values
a_m_cache a table of nested tables containg ty_m values

FUNCTION.NAME: SUBSTITUTE
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE:
Replaces numbered placeholders in compiled Template Expression with values from nested table of varchar2 (p).
Using 
type p is table of varchar2;
makes it possible to use some syntactic sugar for defining values to be placed instead of placeholders.
So say if we want to substitute $1 for 'Dolly' and $2 for 'back' in template expression
'I said hello, $1, / Well, hello, $1 / It's so nice to have you $2 where you belong'
For it we just pass pk_te.p( 'Dolly', 'back' ) into this version of substitute.
FUNCTION.COMMENT:
Replaces numbered placeholders in compiled Template Expression with values from nested table of varchar2 (p).
Using 
type p is table of varchar2;
makes it possible to use some syntactic sugar for defining values to be placed instead of placeholders.
So say if we want to substitute $1 for 'Dolly' and $2 for 'back' in template expression
'I said hello, $1, / Well, hello, $1 / It's so nice to have you $2 where you belong'
For it we just pass pk_te.p( 'Dolly', 'back' ) into this version of substitute.

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_TE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: ty_te template expression compiled for numbered placeholders

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_NUMBERED_REPLACEMENTS
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: nested table of varchar2. Holds values to place instead of placeholders

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_C1
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a sys_refcursor to be used in loop structure substitution

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_C2
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a sys_refcursor to be used in loop structure substitution

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_C3
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a sys_refcursor to be used in loop structure substitution

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_C4
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a sys_refcursor to be used in loop structure substitution

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_C5
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a sys_refcursor to be used in loop structure substitution

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_C6
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a sys_refcursor to be used in loop structure substitution

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_C7
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a sys_refcursor to be used in loop structure substitution

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_C8
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a sys_refcursor to be used in loop structure substitution

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_C9
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a sys_refcursor to be used in loop structure substitution

RETURN.COMMENT: clob - a large character lob with substituted values (if any)

THROWS.COMMENT: if null template expression is passed

THROWS.COMMENT: if passed template expression was compiled for named placeholders

FUNCTION.NAME: SUBSTITUTE
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE:
Replaces named placeholders in compiled Template Expression with values from nested table of nested tables of varchar2 (m).
Using 
type m is table of p;
makes it possible to use syntactic sugar for defining values to be placed instead of placeholders.
So say if we want to substitute {$who} for 'Dolly' and {$how} for 'nice' in template expression
'I said hello, {$who}, / Well, hello, {$who} / It's so {$how} to have you back where you belong'
we just pass pk_te.m( pk_te.p( 'who', 'Dolly' ), pk_te.p( 'how' , 'back' ) ) into this version of substitute function.
Also accepts up to 9 optional cursor parameters what can be used to substitute values inside loop structures defined in
template expression.
FUNCTION.COMMENT:
Replaces named placeholders in compiled Template Expression with values from nested table of nested tables of varchar2 (m).
Using 
type m is table of p;
makes it possible to use syntactic sugar for defining values to be placed instead of placeholders.
So say if we want to substitute {$who} for 'Dolly' and {$how} for 'nice' in template expression
'I said hello, {$who}, / Well, hello, {$who} / It's so {$how} to have you back where you belong'
we just pass pk_te.m( pk_te.p( 'who', 'Dolly' ), pk_te.p( 'how' , 'back' ) ) into this version of substitute function.
Also accepts up to 9 optional cursor parameters what can be used to substitute values inside loop structures defined in
template expression. Also accepts two optional cache parameters that cache results from those cursors

ARGUMENT.COMMENT: ty_te template expression compiled for named placeholders

ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a nested table of nested tables of varchar2 - named values to place instead of placeholders

FUNCTION.NAME: SUBSTITUTE
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE:
Replaces placeholders in compiled Template Expression with values from cursor in iteration.
Each individual substitution is concatenated with the following with optional a_concat_by in between.
Cursor must return instances of ty_p or ty_m UDTs otherwise the function will throw.
FUNCTION.COMMENT:
Replaces placeholders in compiled Template Expression with values from cursor in iteration.
Each individual substitution is concatenated with the following with optional a_concat_by in between.
Cursor must return instances of ty_p or ty_m UDTs otherwise the function will throw.

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_TE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: ty_te compiled template expression

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_CURSOR
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a cursor that must return either instances of ty_m or instances of ty_p

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_CONCAT_BY
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: if present each individual substitutions are concatenated in a loop with a_concat_by in between

RETURN.COMMENT: clob - a large character lob with substituted values (if any)

THROWS.NAME: EX_TE_IS_NULL
THROWS.COMMENT: if null template expression is passed

THROWS.NAME: EX_CURSOR_OF_WRONG_TYPE
THROWS.COMMENT: if passed cursor does not return instances of ty_m or instances of ty_p

TAG.COMMENT: a_te ty_te compiled template expression
a_cursor a cursor that must return either instances of ty_m or instances of ty_p
a_concat_by if present each individual substitutions are concatenated in a loop with a_concat_by in between
EX_TE_IS_NULL if null template expression is passed
EX_CURSOR_OF_WRONG_TYPE if passed cursor does not return instances of ty_m or instances of ty_p
clob - a large character lob with substituted values (if any)

PACKAGE_BODY.NAME: PK_TE_CROSSREF
PACKAGE_BODY.COMMENT:
Package that enables referecing ty_te instances from ty_sph instances by unique ID
Package global collection variable is used to store instances of ty_te and to return them by ID.
This workaround is used while working with loop structures defined in template expression.

FUNCTION.NAME: INSERT_TE_REF
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Store instance of ty_te in global collection
FUNCTION.COMMENT: Store instance of ty_te in global collection

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_TE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: an instance of ty_te to store

RETURN.COMMENT: pls_integer -- an unique ID (within sesion) of stored ty_te

TAG.COMMENT: a_te an instance of ty_te to store
pls_integer -- an unique ID (within sesion) of stored ty_te

FUNCTION.NAME: GET_TE_REF
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Get instance of ty_te from global collection
FUNCTION.COMMENT: Get instance of ty_te from global collection

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_ID
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: an unique ID of stored ty_te

RETURN.COMMENT: ty_te or null if the instance of ty_te was not found in the global collection

TAG.COMMENT: a_id an unique ID of stored ty_te
ty_te or null if the instance of ty_te was not found in the global collection

FUNCTION.NAME: DELETE_TE_REF
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Delete instance of ty_te from global collection by given ID
FUNCTION.COMMENT: Delete instance of ty_te from global collection by given ID

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_ID
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: an unique ID of stored ty_te to delete

RETURN.COMMENT: boolean -- true if the instance of ty_te was found in the global collection and deleted, false otherwise

TAG.COMMENT: a_id an unique ID of stored ty_te to delete
boolean -- true if the instance of ty_te was found in the global collection and deleted, false otherwise

RETURN.TYPE: table OF ty_m_tab INDEX BY binary_integer

FUNCTION.NAME: SUBSTITUTE_
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Following functions are not to be directly called.
FUNCTION.COMMENT: Following functions are not to be directly called. Definition in specification is required to support compile order in the body of package

PACKAGE_BODY.NAME: PK_TE_IMPL
PACKAGE_BODY.COMMENT: Supporting functions that help to implement PK_TE functionality (mostly dealing with recursive calls to handle loop structures). Moved to separate package to expose in PK_TE specification only those types and functions that are to be called by end user.

RETURN.TYPE: table OF varchar2(32767 CHAR) INDEX BY varchar2(100 CHAR)

FUNCTION.NAME: SUBSTITUTE_
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE:
Replaces placeholders in compiled Template Expression with values from cursor in iteration.
Caches results returned from cursor so there's no need to reopen it if more than one loop structures refering this cursor are defined in template expression.
Each individual substitution is concatenated with the following with optional a_concat_by in between.
Cursor must return instances of ty_p or ty_m UDTs (depending on ty_te type) otherwise the function will throw.
FUNCTION.COMMENT:
Replaces placeholders in compiled Template Expression with values from cursor in iteration.
Caches results returned from cursor so there's no need to reopen it if more than one loop structures refering this cursor are defined in template expression.
Each individual substitution is concatenated with the following with optional a_concat_by in between.
Cursor must return instances of ty_p or ty_m UDTs (depending on ty_te type) otherwise the function will throw.

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_LOOP_IDX
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: loop index (1-9) to select appropriate cache

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_TE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: ty_te compiled template expression

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_CURSOR
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a cursor that must return instances of ty_p or of ty_m

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_CONCAT_BY
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: if present each individual substitutions are concatenated in a loop with a_concat_by in between

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_C1
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a sys_refcursor to be used in loop structure substitution

ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a sys_refcursor to be used in loop structure substitution

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_C7

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_C8
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a sys_refcursor to be used in loop structure substitution

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_C9
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a sys_refcursor to be used in loop structure substitution

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_P_CACHE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a cache that stores results of cursor fetches returning ty_p instances

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_M_CACHE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a cache that stores results of cursor fetches returning ty_m instances

RETURN.COMMENT: clob - a large character lob with substituted values (if any)

THROWS.NAME: EX_TE_IS_NULL
THROWS.COMMENT: if null template expression is passed

THROWS.COMMENT: if passed cursor does not return instances of ty_p

THROWS.COMMENT: if passed compiled template expression is not of type ty_te.EL_NUMBERED()

FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Dispatches reqest to substitute cursor values into loop structure to the call of appropriate substitute_ function

FUNCTION.NAME: SUBSTITUTE_
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE:
Replaces numbered placeholders in compiled Template Expression with values from nested table of varchar2 (p).
Simmilar to function substitute for numbered placeholders but is used in subsequent recursive calls to substitute values into loop structures
Redefines cursor parameters as required and adds two cache in out nocopy parameters.
FUNCTION.COMMENT:
Replaces numbered placeholders in compiled Template Expression with values from nested table of varchar2 (p).
Simmilar to function substitute for numbered placeholders but is used in subsequent recursive calls to substitute values into loop structures
Redefines cursor parameters as required and adds two cache in out nocopy parameters.

OBJECT_BODY.NAME: TY_SPH
OBJECT_BODY.COMMENT:
TY_SPH (String Or Placeholder)
A type that represents wrapped clob or numbered/named placeholder or contains references to nested compiled tempate expressions (ty_te).
You can create ty_sph of particular type by calling corresponding static functions.
This type is used in internals of TY_TE as a container of either string, or numbered/named placeholder

FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Constructor implementation
FUNCTION.COMMENT: Constructor implementation

FUNCTION.NAME: CREATE_WRAPPED_STRING
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Creates instance of ty_sph by wrapping string
FUNCTION.COMMENT: Creates instance of ty_sph by wrapping string

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_STRING
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a string to wrap

RETURN.COMMENT: instance of ty_sph

TAG.COMMENT: a_string a string to wrap
instance of ty_sph

FUNCTION.NAME: CREATE_LOOP_CONSTRUCT
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Creates instance of ty_sph by wrapping an instance of ty_te.
FUNCTION.COMMENT:
Creates instance of ty_sph by wrapping an instance of ty_te. Can also assign loop number if nested template expression comes
from loop declaration and the string that will be inserted between individual loop substitutions.

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_LOOP_NUMBER
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: an optional loop number if template expression comes from loop declaration

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_CONCAT_BY
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a string that comes from loop declaration and that will be inserted between individual loop substitutions.

RETURN.COMMENT: instance of ty_sph

TAG.COMMENT: a_te a nested te
a_loop_number an optional loop number if template expression comes from loop declaration
a_concat_by a string that comes from loop declaration and that will be inserted between individual loop substitutions.
instance of ty_sph

OBJECT_BODY.NAME: TY_TE

FUNCTION.NAME: EL_NUMBERED
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Just to be used as class constant
FUNCTION.COMMENT: Just to be used as class constant

FUNCTION.NAME: EL_NAMED
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Just to be used as class constant
FUNCTION.COMMENT: Just to be used as class constant

OBJECT_BODY.COMMENT:
TY_TE (Template Expression)
A type that represents a compiled template expression.
By template expression (TE) we understand a string with numbered or named placeholders.
By compiling TE we understand parsing it, finding numbered or named placeholders and storing the whole expression in internal
structures (a nested table of ty_sph).

FUNCTION.NAME: TY_TE
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Constructor implementation
FUNCTION.COMMENT: Constructor implementation

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_TYPE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Can be either ty_te.EL_NAMED() or ty_te.EL_NUMBERED() - the type of placehoders that were searched while compiling.

RETURN.COMMENT: self

TAG.COMMENT: a_type Can be either ty_te.EL_NAMED() or ty_te.EL_NUMBERED() - the type of placehoders that were searched while compiling.
self

FUNCTION.NAME: ESCAPE_REGEXP_SPECIAL
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Escapes special chars to use as regexp pattern.
FUNCTION.COMMENT: Escapes special chars to use as regexp pattern. Can be used outside of the type as a universal to escape such characters.

FUNCTION.NAME: ESCAPE_BACKREFERENCE
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Escapes regexp backreference to prevent treating substrings of form '\1' ..
FUNCTION.COMMENT:
Escapes regexp backreference to prevent treating substrings of form '\1' .. '\9' in
substitution values as backreference to matched pattern. Can be used as universal function outside the type to escape such backrefs.

FUNCTION.NAME: COMPILE_NUMBERED_OLD
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Parse string for numbered templates in the from $1, $2, etc.
FUNCTION.COMMENT: Parse string for numbered templates in the from $1, $2, etc.

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_TEMPLATE_STRING
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a template string

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_PH_START
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a string that denotes the beginning of numbered placeholder

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_LOOP_PH_BEGIN
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a string that denotes the beginning of loop structure within template expression

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_LOOP_PH_BODY
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a string that separates loop inner tempate expression from cursor number and from loop structure options

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_LOOP_PH_END
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a string that denotes the end of loop structure within template expression

RETURN.COMMENT: The instance of template expression (ty_te)

TAG.COMMENT: a_template_string a template string
a_ph_start a string that denotes the beginning of numbered placeholder
a_loop_ph_begin a string that denotes the beginning of loop structure within template expression
a_loop_ph_body a string that separates loop inner tempate expression from cursor number and from loop structure options
a_loop_ph_end a string that denotes the end of loop structure within template expression
The instance of template expression (ty_te)
pk_te_ex.EX_WRONG_PH_DENOTATION in case of ph denotation misuse

FUNCTION.NAME: PROCESS_LOOP_
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Finds and compiles loop structures inside template expressions
FUNCTION.COMMENT: Finds and compiles loop structures inside template expressions

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_TEMPLATE_STRING
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a template string

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_PH_START
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a string that denotes the beginning of placeholder

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_PH_END
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a string that denotes the end of placeholder

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_TYPE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a type of placeholders to search in string. Actually just may be used to translate to inner loop structures

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_LOOP_PH_BEGIN
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a string that denotes the beginning of loop structure within template expression

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_LOOP_PH_BODY
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a string that separates loop inner tempate expression from cursor number and from loop structure options

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_LOOP_PH_END
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a string that denotes the end of loop structure within template expression

RETURN.COMMENT: The instance of template expression (ty_te) containing loop part or null if no loop structures were found

TAG.COMMENT: a_template_string a template string
a_ph_start a string that denotes the beginning of placeholder
a_ph_end a string that denotes the end of placeholder
a_type a type of placeholders to search in string. Actually just may be used to translate to inner loop structures
a_loop_ph_begin a string that denotes the beginning of loop structure within template expression
a_loop_ph_body a string that separates loop inner tempate expression from cursor number and from loop structure options
a_loop_ph_end a string that denotes the end of loop structure within template expression
The instance of template expression (ty_te) containing loop part or null if no loop structures were found

FUNCTION.NAME: COMPILE_GENERIC_
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE:
Parse string for named or numbered templates
Stores result of parsing in compiled_template_ nested table.
FUNCTION.COMMENT:
Parse string for named or numbered templates
Stores result of parsing in compiled_template_ nested table.

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_TEMPLATE_STRING
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a template string

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_PH_START
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a string that denotes the beginning of placeholder

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_PH_END
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a string that denotes the end of placeholder

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_TYPE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a type of placeholders to search in string. Accepts either ty_te.EL_NUMBERED() or ty_te.EL_NAMED()

RETURN.COMMENT:
The instance of template expression (ty_te) or null if a_type != ty_te.EL_NUMBERED() and a_type != ty_te.EL_NAMED()
or if no teplate expressions were found in string.
Also returns null if there's misuse of placeholder denotation strings (a_ph_start, a_ph_end, a_loop_ph_begin, a_loop_ph_body, a_loop_ph_end).

TAG.COMMENT: a_template_string a template string
a_ph_start a string that denotes the beginning of placeholder
a_ph_end a string that denotes the end of placeholder
a_type a type of placeholders to search in string. Accepts either ty_te.EL_NUMBERED() or ty_te.EL_NAMED()
a_loop_ph_begin a string that denotes the beginning of loop structure within template expression
a_loop_ph_body a string that separates loop inner tempate expression from cursor number and from loop structure options
a_loop_ph_end a string that denotes the end of loop structure within template expression

The instance of template expression (ty_te) or null if a_type != ty_te.EL_NUMBERED() and a_type != ty_te.EL_NAMED()
or if no teplate expressions were found in string.
Also returns null if there's misuse of placeholder denotation strings (a_ph_start, a_ph_end, a_loop_ph_begin, a_loop_ph_body, a_loop_ph_end).

FUNCTION.NAME: CONCAT
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE:
Concatenates two instances of compiled template expressions to costruct new instance
with combined compiled_template_ tables peserving the order (values from a_lhv.compiled_template_ first
, from a_rhv.compiled_template_ second).
FUNCTION.COMMENT:
Concatenates two instances of compiled template expressions to costruct new instance
with combined compiled_template_ tables peserving the order (values from a_lhv.compiled_template_ first
, from a_rhv.compiled_template_ second).

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_LHV
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: first template expression to combine

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_RHV
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: second template expression to combine

RETURN.COMMENT:
ty_te the instance of ty_te with compiled_template_ nested table containg ty_sph instances from a_lhl and plus instances from a_rhv
or null if either of parameters is null

TAG.COMMENT: a_lhv first template expression to combine
a_rhv second template expression to combine

ty_te the instance of ty_te with compiled_template_ nested table containg ty_sph instances from a_lhl and plus instances from a_rhv
or null if either of parameters is null

PROCEDURE.NAME: GET_CALLER_INFO
PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Gets calling module info including owner, type, name, line at desired call stack depth The refactored version of one that <a href="http://tkyte.blogspot.com/2009/10/httpasktomoraclecomtkytewhocalledme.html">Tom Kyte wrote<a>
PROCEDURE.COMMENT: Gets calling module info including owner, type, name, line at desired call stack depth The refactored version of one that <a href="http://tkyte.blogspot.com/2009/10/httpasktomoraclecomtkytewhocalledme.html">Tom Kyte wrote<a>

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_DESIRED_DEPTH
ARGUMENT.COMMENT:
the depth in the call stack from this function and up
So say providing 2 as a depth we can get not the caller of GET_CALLER_INFO but the caller of the function that called GET_CALLER_INFO

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_REAL_DEPTH
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: returns the real depth if it's less then desired

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_CALLER_TYPE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: returns caller type ('PACKAGE', 'PACKAGE BODY', etc.)

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_CALLER_OWNER
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: returns caller owner

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_CALLER_NAME
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: returns caller name

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_LINE_NUMBER
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: returns caller line number

TAG.COMMENT:
a_desired_depth the depth in the call stack from this function and up
So say providing 2 as a depth we can get not the caller of GET_CALLER_INFO but the caller of the function that called GET_CALLER_INFO
a_real_depth returns the real depth if it's less then desired
a_caller_type returns caller type ('PACKAGE', 'PACKAGE BODY', etc.)
a_caller_owner returns caller owner
a_caller_name returns caller name
a_line_number returns caller line number

PROCEDURE.NAME: ASSERT
PROCEDURE.COMMENT:
Accert procedure. Is to be called from unit test functions. Automatically gets caller info and stores
it and the result of accertion in ut_report table. As all unit tests are Package body procedures their name can only
be infered during analysis of package body source code. This analysis is done when accessing ut_report_deciphered view

ARGUMENT.NAME: A
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: accertion as a boolean value. If accertion is true, 'Passed' is inserted in ut_report along with caller info, 'Failed!' otherwise.

TAG.COMMENT: a accertion as a boolean value. If accertion is true, 'Passed' is inserted in ut_report along with caller info, 'Failed!' otherwise.

PROCEDURE.NAME: PRINT_MAP
PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Prints values stored in ty_m nested table of nested tables of varchar.
PROCEDURE.COMMENT: Prints values stored in ty_m nested table of nested tables of varchar. Only ty_p having 2 elements ( key => value ) are considered appropriate

ARGUMENT.NAME: A_MAP
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: a map to print contents of

TAG.COMMENT: a_map a map to print contents of

PROCEDURE.NAME: RUN_TESTS
PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Public package procedure that actually runs tests.
PROCEDURE.COMMENT: Public package procedure that actually runs tests. Test results are stored in ut_report.
